class_notes:
Business Communication in the Globalized World: the Case of Japan and Italy
Crosslisted with ITAL 276-2
Profs. Muratore/Mizzotta (Mon-Wed. 1-2:15pm in person)
Content:  This course will prioritize the acquisition of business-related vocabulary, an understanding of best practices for business communication and etiquette, as well as the development of collaborative and communication skills. This course consists of classroom lectures in English (whole class), language-based sessions (Italian group and Japanese group will meet separately), and a community-engaged learning module.   Prerequisites: ITAL/JPN 202.
course_description: Study of Japanese language, literature, society, thought, or culture, alone or in conjunction with other literary or cultural trends. Topics to be announced in advance.
